chargeHist.descr: Possess Firearm-Adjudicated Deliquent of a Felony

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amaryon L Singleton

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amaryon L Singleton in court.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Amaryon L Singleton.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case scheduled for status of counsel. Attorney Lori Kuehn has recently been appointed and needs more time to review case with client. Defense requests a status conference date.
Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Amaryon L Singleton in court.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court for Amaryon L Singleton.  Attorney Michael Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin on behalf of Attorney Samuel E. Simpson.

Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense informs the court that there is a conflict of interest and withdrawal from the case is necessary.  Court grants Defense's motion to withdraw and schedules a status of counsel hearing.  Court advised the defendant to visit Justice Point right after court hearing and further advises Mr. Singleton that all previously conditions of bail remain in full force effect, including NO POSSESSION of dangerous weapons or firearms.  State Public Defender's Office notified of next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 09-15-2022

Defendant Amaryon L Singleton in court, appear in person with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont, appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEARED BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Violation Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.
Justice Point Violation Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Amaryon L Singleton in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Amaryon L Singleton in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amaryon L Singleton appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38. All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Defense motions for Plea for Misdemeanor counts 2 and 3 to be withheld for Preliminary Hearing.   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
